content.description:
Image of Triple Crucifix, Kingdom of Kongo, Sixteenth to Nineteenth Century

The largest crucifix is in the center.
Above the largest crucifix is a small crucifix.
Below the largest crucifix is another small crucifix.
Gift of Ernst Anspach, 1999. The Metropolitan Museum of Art.
content.question: Which of the following best describes the context in which the triple crucifix was created?

choices.label: The Kingdom of Kongo traded directly with China and India so that Asian artistic styles blended with local traditions.
The Kingdom of Kongo isolated itself and prohibited trade with parties outside of the kingdom for an extended time period.
The movement of Bantu people into the Kingdom of Kongo brought new languages and technology to West Central Africa.
The royalty and nobility of the Kingdom of Kongo voluntarily converted to Catholicism, and the faith gained mass acceptance.

content.answer: The royalty and nobility of the Kingdom of Kongo voluntarily converted to Catholicism, and the faith gained mass acceptance.
